I am working at creating a version NEAT in National Instrument's 
LabView. =
 I am using Buckland's NEAT for Windows code as a convention 
to follow.  I=
t has proven extremely helpful and Buckland is to be 
commended for his com=
ments and consistancy.

There is a small section of code in the CGenome::Ad=
dLink function 
that as far as I can determine serves no purpose and may be=
 an 
artifact from when it was originally written:

      if (ID_neuron2 =
=3D=3D 2)
      {
        continue;
      }

What possible reason would it =
matter if this statement were true or 
false?

Also, Buckland's sigmoid fun=
ction is written as:

//------------------------------------Sigmoid functio=
n----------------
//
//----------------------------------------------------=
----------------

float Sigmoid(float netinput, float response)
{
	return (=
 1 / ( 1 + exp(-netinput / response)));
}

where "response" is the dActivat=
ionResponse value which one can 
choose to mutate.

I understand that this =
changes the slope of the sigmoid curve.  
Wouldn't it be better to multiply=
 "netinput" by "response" so a case 
of dividing by zero does not ever occu=
r?

Thanks

Raymond
